# Unused local variables should be removed

If a local variable is declared but not used, it is dead code and should be removed. Doing so will improve maintainability because developers will not wonder what the variable is used for.

Root cause: Variable declared but never referenced in scope

Fix: 1. Remove the unused variable declaration
2. Review code logic to ensure variable was not intended to be used
3. Consider using underscore prefix for intentionally unused variables

# Tabulation characters should not be used

Developers should not need to configure the tab width of their text editors in order to be able to read source code. So the use of tabulation character must be forbidden.

Root cause: Mixed use of tabs and spaces for indentation

Fix: 1. Replace all tabs with spaces (typically 4 spaces per tab in Python)
2. Configure editor to show whitespace characters
3. Set up automated formatting tools like Black or autopep8
